fiarautoplayer
Class SARSALearner

java.lang.Object
  fiarautoplayer.GreedyQPolicy
      fiarautoplayer.SARSALearner
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAlgorithm
public class SARSALearner
extends GreedyQPolicy

Class responsible for the implementation of SARSA Q-Learning algorithm. As it's an on policy algorithm we chose as it's policy an epsilon greedy Q policy

Constructor Summary
SARSALearner(QFunctionApproximator Qapprox, double epsilon, double gamma, int played)
          Constructs an instance of the learner using a preloaded Q and learning params

Constructor Detail

SARSALearner

public SARSALearner(QFunctionApproximator Qapprox,
                    double epsilon,
                    double gamma,
                    int played)
Constructs an instance of the learner using a preloaded Q and learning params

Parameters:
Qapprox - Preloaded Q function representation
epsilon - Exploration parameter
gamma - Discount parameter
played - Amount of games played so far to learn the preloaded Q used to calculate learning rate
Method Detail

initState

public void initState()
resets learner state updates to the Q function are made only after result of the first move. We keep the last move information as our state. When starting a new game we need to reset this state using this method.

Specified by:
initState in interface IAlgorithm
Overrides:
initState in class GreedyQPolicy

reportLoss

public void reportLoss(FIARState currentState,
                       Color loserColor,
                       int reward)
                throws java.lang.Exception
Used to report a game which ended with a loss When a game is over with the RLGamer using the SARSALearner algorithm as it's policy losing it needs to inform the learner inorder to perform a Q update

returnNextMove

public Move returnNextMove(FIARState currentState,
                           Color myColor)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Main entry point. This method uses either the HardCodedMoves (for bootstrapping) or the greedy policy to get the next Move. Then it perform the update rule as appropriate while updating the information about the current move so it can be used during the next update.

Specified by:
returnNextMove in interface IAlgorithm
Overrides:
returnNextMove in class GreedyQPolicy
Parameters:
currentState -
myColor -
Returns:
chosen move
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
